“Wanna Go? Let Me Know!” would connect outgoing tenants, incoming tenants, and landlords in a simple, privacy-respecting way.

  • Tenants can anonymously signal their intent to move out (e.g., “leaving in 2 months”).
  • Interested families can subscribe to neighborhood alerts.
  • Landlords can plan listings earlier and reduce vacancy periods.
  • Local governments can use anonymized data to forecast housing demand.

Impact:

  • Reduces housing search stress.
  • Increases rental transparency.
  • Builds a more cooperative rental ecosystem.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
In many European countries, rental laws require tenants to give a three-month notice before leaving a property. However, there’s no transparent way for other renters or families to know which flats will soon be available.
As a result:
* Families (especially with multiple kids) struggle to plan moves in advance. * Apartments remain empty between contracts. * Communities experience unnecessary stress and time pressure when relocating.
There’s a clear gap between people planning to leave and those searching for housing - a gap that technology can bridge.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • App Engine Studio - to build the main app where tenants can register move-out plans and families can subscribe to regions.
  • Flow Designer - to automate notifications when an apartment is flagged for release.
  • Now Experience UI Builder - to create a clean, map-based interface showing upcoming availability.
  • IntegrationHub - to integrate with external platforms, alerts or connect with housing authority APIs.
  • Performance Analytics - to generate insights for community housing patterns.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with GIS or mapping APIs (Google Maps, OpenStreetMap) for regional visualization.
  • Optional integration with real estate or city housing databases.
  • Secure user authentication to protect identity and data.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Protecting tenant privacy while enabling useful insights.
  • Motivating users to share move-out information early.
  • Standardizing integration with various property listing systems.
  • Ensuring compliance with regional housing and data protection laws (e.g., GDPR).
